p: The average temperature of Ms was determined from the dilatation curves in which only the martensite structure was formed. We used the first five cooling curves from 100 °C∙s −1 to 0.5 °C∙s −1. The results are shown in Figure 8. By averaging these five temperatures from the individual curves, the average temperature Ms was of 282 °C. We could not measure the temperature Mf on any curve, because the austenite to martensite transformation occurred below RT (room temperature). We can observe that as the cooling rate lowers, the temperature Ms also decreases.
